item.title: I'm Back
item.description: In the beginning of time, this blog was hosted by myself in the rack servers I host in my garage. However, those rack servers, even if they make a nice homelab, are way too old (they were way too cheap) and are way too powerful to be powered one just to host my tiny blog. So I powered them down and moved the site to a Raspberry Pi 4 stored in a drawer.

item.title: Summer Indolency
item.description: So here we are. 40 degrees on the thermometer for us poor lads of the south. It makes it difficult to live, to concentrate or even to breathe. But nevertheless I am still following the DHH news on twitter. He made public the technologies the server side backend of hey.com is based into and it is like a return to 2012. Ruby on Rails, monolithic, server side html rendering, no javascript.

item.title: When postmoderns face capitalism
item.description: Today is going to be a funny story. David Heinemeier Hansson is the CTO of a small company called Basecamp and a very public figure in the field of software because it is the creator of Ruby on Rails. Currently, he is in the middle of a huge launch of their new product: HEY.com, an email service (innovative, uh?). This email service comes packed with innovative features, the most important one is that it does not support any know email protocol.

item.title: Sun, Go and Java
item.description: This week has been sunny and hot down here, which is something after 2 years in the Netherlands I still are not very used to. I have been thinking a lot about programming languages (conclusions might appear on this very blog in the future). I grew up as a developer programming in Java. I have dedicated countless hours to the Java programming language. I also dedicated some time to Ruby (on Rails) back in 2008.

item.title: My Thing
item.description: So, a new blog has born on the 21st century internet. No blogging platform, no Medium, no content aggregation, no social media. Just a good old fashioned web page where a guy rambles against things or supports other things. We’ll see. Who’s that me that is going to be the star of the thing? Software engineer, systems administrator, mix of both, father, lover. You can find all the interesting crap in my Linkedin profile, here is irrelevant.
